text: I played this game in the PS3 era as PSOne classic. Neat controls and nice stage design and music. Overall the game provides a satisfying experience. Highly recommended!

text: So nostalgic. Every time I hear this, it brings me back to when I was younger playing this for the Wii back with my family, I remember we used to have fun and see who could beat which level first. text: This game was unbelievably fun to just pick up and play, the controls were quite generous/simple to learn and I thought their vocalizations during narrating were absolutely hilarious.  It was incoherant nonsense, but very amusing.
author: fate255

text: This track for me captures the heart of the PlayStation, in general. That era of gaming that was so new at the time and yet so professional in its game-making. The music was superb and exquisite like this. It had to be. PlayStation literally made a name for itself with exclusive titles, like Klonoa. Hopefully that trend will never die. The innovation of Sony impresses me even to this day.
author: EXEJON

text: I was touched by your comment, good sir. May your mother rest in peace!

text: I dunno if you already knew this since it;s been a year since your comment, but after you beat the game you can get the original voices back, And yes. It was WAY easier then before the Wii Remake.

text: Whenever I hear this song I think of Doctor Who, envisioning a dead Gallifrey and the last double-heartbeat of a dying Time Lord fading away.
author: Zeppelee

text:
Beautiful, brought tears to my eyes, lots of memories from when I was little & I also remember my mother crying over the ending to this game, but unfortunetly it has been 7 years since she passed away.

R.I.P Mother, I will always love you, my heart beats for you in this track.

author: Vordox

text: @TheTKC I quite liked the wii version, it lives up to the original quite well so long as you turn the english voices off. It's not that the voices are bad so much as you get more charm out of the phantomilian voices. It's also fairly cheap, especially compared to the original. I think I saw Klonoa for the PSX going for around 100 dollars but I got my wii one new for 30 bucks. I'd say it's a steal.

author: MasterChibi

text: For including this song, you get a free WA-HOO!
author: SimuRei

text: Finished this game again in one sitting yesterday, I hadn't played it since its release so I needed to refresh my memories. It's still a really fun game so it aged very well. I remember the ending making me sad back then and I know I wasn't alone! This song really stood out for me yesterday (especially when 1:42 hit), it's very chill/dreamy and you know you're near the end. The first half of the song takes place inside the tower and the other half outside, with less instruments and more ambient.
author: SupraDarky
